page.title: 16THE ROCKS OF SHIELDAIG
page.content: MUCH OF LAND AROUND SHIELDAIG IS ROCKY.THE MOUNTAINS ARE TORRIDONIAN SANDSTONE. THEY WERE ONCE UNDER THE SEA, BUT HAVE RISEN UP TO FORM LAND. THE LAND WAS THEN WORN AWAY BY GLACIERS. THE ROCKS OF THIS TYPE ARE CALLED SEDEMENTARY ROCKS. THE POINT BEYOND THE SCHOOL IS CALLED CAMAS-RUADH. THIS LAND IS ROUGH AND ROCKS. UNDER THE SURFACE IS LEWISIAN GNEISS. THIS IS SOME OF THE OLDEST ROCK IN NORTHERN EUROPE. THE BEACHES ARE ROCKY, WITH MANY STONES. THESE ARE MAINLY PINK IN COLOUR BUT HAVE BEEN WORN SMOOTH AND ROUND BY THE SEA. THE BEACHES CONTAIN A VARIETY OF STONES - GRANITE, QUARTZ, BUT MAINLY SANDSTONE. THIS VARIETY OF SANDSTONE IS VERY HARD AND FOUND ONLY IN THIS AREA.
